citation.article-title: Reclassification of Arachnia propionica as Propionibacterium propionicus comb. nov.

p.s: Propionibacterium (Pro.pi.on.i.bac.te'ri.um. M. L. n. acidum propionicum, propionic acid; Gr. dim.n. bakterion, a small rod; M. L. neut. n. Propionihacterium propionic acid bacterium)
The description of the genus is as given in Bergey 's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology (4) but should be emended to include the information below.
Short diphtheroid rods, 0.2 to 0.8 μm in diameter by 1 to 5 μm long, which may or may not be branched.
Branching filaments may be 5 to 20 μm or more long.
Swollen spherical cells resembling spheroplasts, up to 5 to 20 μm in diameter, are formed by some strains.
Highly filamentous microcolonies (composed of long, branched, septate and nonseptate filaments) may also be observed.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains either diaminopimelic acid or lysine as the dibasic amino acid.
Tetrahydrogenated menaquinones with nine isoprene units [MK-9(H4)] are the major respiratory quinones.
The long-chain cellular fatty acids are of the straight chain saturated, iso- and anteiso-methyl branched types; monounsaturated acids may also be present in small amounts .
